mil3.7.8:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.7.8:1.2_0: “Smelling such a deed and knowingly do they know the difference between one bad deeds?”
mil3.7.8:1.3_0: “Great king, if a senior monk does, he’s bad deeds, even more bad deeds.”
mil3.7.8:1.4_0: “Well then, sir, since I don’t know that our son or their minister, let us do that bad deed?”
mil3.7.8:1.5_0: “What do you think, great king? Which one of them could know whether someone is burning or not?”
mil3.7.8:1.7_0: “In the same way, if anyone does bad deeds, they wouldn’t make bad karma.”
mil3.7.8:3.1_0: The eighth section for recitation on Not knowing and seeing have been laid down.
